duties_responsibilities.duty: Design and build highly available BizTalk environments, including installation and configuration.
Understand and demonstrate best practices for Hosts, host instances, host separation, tracking, tuning.
Configure SSO and understand best practices for SSO, master secret server, high availability, and DR.
Maintain BTS DBs and apply best practices for databases used by BizTalk.
Develop BizTalk applications, creation of schemas, maps, pipelines, orchestration, and experience with Visual Studio and BizTalk design time components.
Troubleshoot performance issues, set up and analyze performance counters, and manage throttling issues.
Monitor and maintain BizTalk Health Monitor, Maintenance/Terminator tool, BAM, and ESB configurations.
Manage IIS, Web Services/WCF, and Line Of Business adapters.
Collaborate with State/Local Government entities and be available for occasional customer escalation.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
